cancellation.policy: Lessons cancelled with less than 24 hours notice will be charged at full rate. Emergency situations will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

rescheduling.policy: Free rescheduling with 24+ hours notice. Package students get flexible rescheduling throughout their package period.

payment.timing: Payment due at time of booking for single lessons, or before first lesson for packages.

makeups.policy: Missed lessons due to illness or emergency can be made up within the package period or following month for single lessons.

faq.question: Do I need to own a guitar to start lessons?
faq.answer: For in-person lessons, I have guitars available, but having your own instrument for practice is highly recommended. For online lessons, you'll need your own guitar.

faq.question: What style of music do you teach?
faq.answer: While I specialize in blues improvisation, my approach applies to many genres including rock, jazz, folk, and contemporary music. We'll explore styles that interest you.

faq.question: How quickly will I see progress?
faq.answer: Most students notice improvement within the first few lessons, especially in confidence and understanding. Significant technical and creative progress typically develops over 2-3 months of consistent practice.

faq.question: Are you suitable for complete beginners?
faq.answer: Absolutely! I love working with beginners and have a structured approach that builds skills gradually. Many of my most successful students started with no musical experience.

faq.question: What if I can't practice much between lessons?
faq.answer: I understand busy schedules. We'll work together to find realistic practice solutions, even if it's just 10-15 minutes a few times a week. Quality practice matters more than quantity.
